SEARCH
Package org.fluentjdbc

Class DbContextTable

java.lang.Object
org.fluentjdbc.DbContextTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatabaseQueryable<DbContextSelectBuilder>
@CheckReturnValue public class DbContextTable extends Object implements DatabaseQueryable<DbContextSelectBuilder>
Provides a thread context oriented way of manipulating a table. Create from DbContext. All database operations must be nested in DbContext.startConnection(DataSource).

Usage examples

 DbContextTable table = context.table("database_test_table");
 try (DbContextConnection ignored = context.startConnection(dataSource)) {
     table.insert().setField("code", 102).execute();
     table.query().where("key", key).orderBy("value").listStrings("value");
     table.where("id", id).update().setField("value", newValue).execute();
     table.where("id", id).delete();

     table.newSaveBuilderWithUUID("id", o.getId()).setField("name", o.getName()).execute();
 }

    • DbContextTable

      public DbContextTable(DatabaseTable databaseTable, @Nonnull DbContext dbContext)

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public DbContextInsertBuilder insert()
      Creates a DbContextInsertBuilder object to fluently generate a INSERT ... statement. Example: 
           table.insert().setField("id", id).setField("name", name).execute();

    • unordered

      public DbContextSelectBuilder unordered()
      Creates a query() ready for list-operations without any ORDER BY clause

    • orderedBy

      public DbContextSelectBuilder orderedBy(String orderByClause)
      Creates a query() ready for list-operations with ORDER BY ... clause

    • newSaveBuilder

      public DbContextSaveBuilder<Long> newSaveBuilder(String idColumn, Long idValue)
      Creates a DbContextSaveBuilder which creates a INSERT or UPDATE statement, depending on whether the row already exists in the database. If idValue is null, DbContextSaveBuilder will attempt to use the table's autogeneration of primary keys if there is no row with matching unique keys

    • newSaveBuilderWithString

      public DbContextSaveBuilder<String> newSaveBuilderWithString(String idColumn, String idValue)
      Creates a DbContextSaveBuilder which creates a INSERT or UPDATE statement, depending on whether the row already exists in the database. Throws exception if idValue is null

    • newSaveBuilderWithUUID

      public DbContextSaveBuilder<UUID> newSaveBuilderWithUUID(String field, UUID uuid)
      Creates a DbContextSaveBuilder which creates a INSERT or UPDATE statement, depending on whether the row already exists in the database. Generates UUID.randomUUID if idValue is null and row with matching unique keys does not already exist

    • save

      public <T> DbContextSaveBuilder<T> save(DatabaseSaveBuilder<T> saveBuilder)
      Associates the argument DatabaseSaveResult with this DbContextTable's DbContext

    • cache

      public <KEY, ENTITY> SingleRow<ENTITY> cache(KEY key, DbContext.RetrieveMethod<KEY,ENTITY> retriever)
      Retrieves the underlying or cached value of the retriever argument. This cache is per DbContextConnection and is evicted when the connection is closed. The key is in context of this table, so different tables can have the same key without collision

    • alias

      public DbContextTableAlias alias(String alias)
      Create a DbContextTableAlias associated with this DbContextTable which can be used to JOIN statements with DbContextTableAlias.join(DatabaseColumnReference, DatabaseColumnReference).
      See Also:
      • DbContextJoinedSelectBuilder

    • query

      public DbContextSelectBuilder query()
      Creates a DbContextSelectBuilder which allows you to query the table by generating "SELECT ..." statements
      Specified by:
      query in interface DatabaseQueryable<DbContextSelectBuilder>

    • sync

      public <T> DbContextSyncBuilder<T> sync(List<T> entities)
      Creates a DbContextSyncBuilder which allows you to synchronize the data in the table with an external source

    • bulkInsert

      public <T> DbContextBulkInsertBuilder<T> bulkInsert(@Nonnull Stream<T> objects)
      Creates a DbContextBulkInsertBuilder object to fluently generate a INSERT ... statement for a list of objects. Example: 
           public void saveAll(List<TagType> tagTypes) {
         tagTypesTable.bulkInsert(tagTypes)
             .setField("name", TagType::getName)
             .generatePrimaryKeys("id", TagType::setId)
             .execute();
     }

    • bulkInsert

      public <T> DbContextBulkInsertBuilder<T> bulkInsert(Iterable<T> objects)
      Creates a DbContextBulkInsertBuilder object to fluently generate a INSERT ... statement for a list of objects. Example: 
           public void saveAll(List<TagType> tagTypes) {
         tagTypesTable.bulkInsert(tagTypes)
             .setField("name", TagType::getName)
             .generatePrimaryKeys("id", TagType::setId)
             .execute();
     }

    • bulkDelete

      public <T> DbContextBulkDeleteBuilder<T> bulkDelete(@Nonnull Stream<T> objects)
      Creates a DbContextBulkDeleteBuilder object to fluently generate a DELETE ... statement for a list of objects. Example:

      Example:

           public void deleteAll(Stream<TagType> tagTypes) {
         tagTypesTable.bulkDelete(tagTypes)
              .where("id", TagType::getId)
              .execute();
     }

    • bulkDelete

      public <T> DbContextBulkDeleteBuilder<T> bulkDelete(Iterable<T> objects)
      Creates a DbContextBulkDeleteBuilder object to fluently generate a DELETE ... statement for a list of objects. Example:

      Example:

           public void deleteAll(List<TagType> tagTypes) {
         tagTypesTable.bulkDelete(tagTypes)
              .where("id", TagType::getId)
              .execute();
     }

    • bulkUpdate

      public <T> DbContextBulkUpdateBuilder<T> bulkUpdate(@Nonnull Stream<T> objects)
      Creates a DbContextBulkUpdateBuilder object to fluently generate a UPDATE ... statement for a list of objects. Example: 
           public void updateAll(Stream<TagType> tagTypes) {
         tagTypesTable.bulkUpdate(tagTypes)
              .where("id", TagType::getId)
              .setField("name", TagType::getName)
              .execute();
     }
